result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamel L Braylock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample for Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable Court costs and surcharges.
To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison wages. 
Unpaid balance to be paid during period of Extended Supervision or converted to civil judgment.

Defendant is not eligible for  Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*6/16/2016  Honorable Federick C. Rosa-Order signed.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

superMiscConds.notes: NO CONTACT with victim, STEVEN R
all terms and conditions of PSI writer (except no contact with co-actors)
AODA assessment, follow through with recommended programming

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to: WI DEPT OF CORRECTIONS- RACINE CORRECTIONAL INSTITUTION. 2019 WISCONSIN STREET. STURTEVANT, WI 53177-1829. FAX #: 262-886-7828. ew
As originally assigned Court not in session on this day, case forwarded to Br. 10, Judge Havas to review ERP request.  jm

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 37, Judge Dee.  jm

per order dated December 13, 2016, Appeal 2016XX394CR, the motion for reconsideration, so construed, is granted in part and denied in part, as specified below. Court Reporter Nancy Czerniejewski must file the transcripts in this matter with the clerk of the circuit court, serve copies on the parties, and notify the clerk of the court of appeals that the transcripts have been filed no later than Tuesday, January 17, 2017. If Court Reporter Nancy Czerniejewski fails to comply with this order, she is ineligible to act as official court reporter in any court proceeding and is prohibited from performing any private reporting work as of Tuesday, January 24, 2017. the sancation will remain in place until Czerniejewski filed the overdue transcripts with the clerk of the circuit court, serves copies on the parties, and notifies the clerk of the court of appeals that the transcripts have been filed.

per order dated November 29, 2016, Appeal 2016XX394CR, the motion to compel the production of transcripts is granted. Court Reporter Nancy Czerniejewski must file the transcripts in this matter with the clerk of the circuit court, serve copies on the parties no later than Thursday, December 22, 2016. Court Reporter Nancy Czerniejewski fails to comply with this order, she is ineligible to act as an official court reporter in any court proceeding and is prohibited from performing any private reporting work as of Tuesday, December 27, 2016. The sanctions will remain in place until Czerniejewski filed the overdue transcripts with the clerk of the circuit court, serves copies on the parties, and notifies the clerk of the court of appeals that the transcripts have been filed.

per order dated October 10, 2016, Appeal 2016XX394CR, the deadline for Court Reporter Czerniejewski to file transcripts in this matter is extended through November 7, 2016. The motion to compel Reprter Czerniejewski to produce transcripts is denied.
per order dated September 23, 2016, Appeal 2016XX394CR, no later than October 10, 2016, Court Reporter Nancy S. Czerniejewski shall file and serve a response to Braylock's motion.
Per Order signed on 6/16/2016:  "JOC shall be amended to state that the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program".

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Jamel L Braylock in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Defendant Jamel L Braylock in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, with credit for 231 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

Court orders the following conditions of extended supervision:
- all terms and conditions of PSI writer (except no contact with co-actors)
- No contact with victim, STEVEN R.
- AODA assessment, follow through with recommended programming
- seek and maintain full time employment
- 50 hours of community service

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison wages.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid portion to convert to a civil judgment. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
- filed.

Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court, defendant Jamel L Braylock not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Due to court calendar congestion, Court ordered the matter adjourned for sentencing in Branch 35.
Letters in support of the defendant received and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box D272A
cf

At the hour of 2:02 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of Guilty which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  PSI with recommendations ordered.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-28-2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury continued deliberations.

Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:32 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Regan and Cook who were duly sworn for that purpose.
Sworn for defense: Jamel Braylock and Michael Blankenshit. Exhibits 21-26 State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.
Sworn for the state:  MPD Officers Todd Bohlen and Charles Carbelli, Michelle Eckert. Exhibits  11-20 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.
Trial proceeded.  Court continued instructing the jury. Sworn for the state: Stephen Roe, Andrew Wagner, MPD Officers Donald Krezien and Jeremey Greene. Exhibits  1-11 received.

Defendant Jamel L Braylock in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:36 pm.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.
Defendant's Second Witness List.
State's Requested Jury Instructions and Motion in Limine.

Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court, defendant Jamel L Braylock not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case still in trial posture.

Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court, defendant Jamel L Braylock not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 6.9.15 and for jury trial on 7.20.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamel L Braylock in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Defendant Jamel L Braylock in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Rodney Young-MPD Detective.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Defense Counsel had requested a Demand For Speedy Trial, but withdrew the request after court was informed that the defendant was on a VOP hold.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with STEPHEN R., ANDREW S., MICHELLE E. AND ANDREW W.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jamel L Braylock in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Jamel L Braylock in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Commission advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
